section:
The Grit Game Engine allows you to create rich 3D interactive worlds using Lua scripting. All gameplay logic, graphical elements, physical behaviour, AI, sound, and everything else is ultimately controlled via general-purpose Lua APIs. This manual serves as a reference for the APIs and frameworks for those APIs, complete with discussion and examples.
Grit is open source and is released under a liberal license. It can be used for both commercial and non-commercial projects. The copyright and license for the code and assets within the project package breaks down as follows:
Grit core works consist of:
The C++ code for the engine itself.
Python and Maxscript code used in exporters.
All Luaimg code.
All assets and Lua code in system/.
All Lua code in common/ and vehicles/.
These works are sufficient to build a game containing custom assets. It covers all non-trivial code released as part of Grit. The works are relased under the MIT license:

There is also some example content provided with the engine, and the copyright situation for these is more complex. It is not expected that third parties will be re-using and reselling these assets, as they exist only to demonstrate the engine. Furthermore, unlike source code, it is hard to find good quality assets under permissive licenses.
Some assets have copyright owned by project contributors, and are released under liberal licenses such as MIT or CC-BY, just like the source code. But other assets have less liberal licenses such as CC-SA, CC-NC or GPL. Furthermore, many assets are taken from stock image sites and thus copyright is still owned by those sites. In these latter cases, care must be taken to use the assets in accordance with the appropriate licenses, as dictated by their copyright owners.
Each directory has a copyright.txt file that lists the copyright owner, license of each asset in that directory. Each element of an atlas will be described in copyright.txt unless all elements of the atlas are subject to the same license. Modifications to assets may also be mentioned in copyright.txt. Any important restrictions on the license are also given.
